caption: Delicious food and a beautiful atmosphere  I would recommend listening to your server ~ all his recommendations were amazing. The honey feta was soo good and the lamb meatballs I loved the most. I would come back over and over if I lived here.

From the creators of D.C. best cupcake (Baked & Wired) and breakfast biscuit (A Baked Joint) comes a family dinner restaurant in Mount Vernon Triangle. It's a family-friendly restaurant with stunning design that appeals to all crowds.  However, it's takeout only during the pandemic, but you get a glimpse when you go inside to safely pick up your food.  Where La Betty shines is with the sides. We ordered two sides that were outstanding- the caramelized cauliflower mash and the broccoli.  The main dishes weren't bad either. My chicken schnitzel sammie was pretty big with great flavor. My wife's Betty Burger was good, but nothing to write home about.  They have a generous list of beer, hard cider, wine and cocktails. For $6, you get a classy bottle of a ready-to-drink cocktail that is surprisingly mixed perfectly. The "Fomo" is a refreshing drink with a little kick.  Overall, La Betty was a good experience.
Really liked the new menu. The jerk chicken dish is so so good! Could eat the side sauce all day long. Definitely recommend.
When they say it feels like you are eating in the owner's house, they aren't kidding. Down home cooking. Bread phenomenal, great portions. We will be back!
Fantastic food and service
Absolutely loved the meal at la Betty last night! We split the corn dogs & pretzels— both delicious. I can’t wait to go back!
Can't wait to go back? You must try the butternut squash spaetzl!
Stumbled upon this place, the ribs were amazing! Plus the cocktail I had went well with the "Best Nuts Ever". I definitely will return for some comfort food and drinks.

Love the ambience of this place. Super cool layout along with funky light fixtures. You keep getting topped up with beers untill you cover your glass with a coaster. Our server was great. Wish the beer glasses were a little bigger, found my self finishing the little glasses fast. Got the schnitzel which was delicious. The devil eggs were a great starter.

This is a very nice place - a hidden gem in Mt. Vernon Triangle! The atmosphere is wonderful, and the food is flavorful and well-priced. Be sure to get the bread basket from neighboring a Baked Joint, as it is a great selection of homemade breads. La Betty is a wonderful place to stop in for a bite to eat!

Every time I walk in, I instantly feel like I'm home. The deviled eggs, cheesecake and schnitzel are standbys. The Kölsch is a fantastic pair with the whole menu.  Go as frequently as you can while it's still a well kept secret, one day you'll walk in and be completely unable to get a table. Can't wait to come back again, even after my 4th time here.
Tasty simple food, simple ambience and excellent service.. Good value
Held a birthday dinner here, everything was great in terms of coordination and service was quick.

Everything about this restaurant, from the REALLY GOOD FOOD to the last of the design details makes you feel like you are sitting at home for an excellent dinner.Yummy and beautiful, highly recommended.

La Betty is a great casual neighborhood spot that serves some lovely dishes from the owners of Baked and Wired and abakedjoint. Went to the soft launch night and had a great time trying a wide range of the dishes they have to offer, and liked almost all of them. The service was excellent and very receptive to feedback, and I’ll definitely be returning soon to try more.

Nothing special. I wouldn’t go back. Pretty limited menu. The best thing was the ribs, which were cooked perfectly with a sweet sauce. Everything else we had, well, I think anyone can make better at home! Apparently they will only cook the $15 burger well done. It’s hard to mess up a twice-baked potato, but La Betty managed to do so. I think they forgot butter and were pretty light with the cheese. Only one red wine option, which was a surprisingly sweet cotes du Rhône.

I love this place. I LOVE THIS PLACE. Why isn’t it more popular? Why would you go to prathers instead of here? Honestly, an underrated place with great food, great drinks, and great service. Love it, can’t wait to go back.
My food was served cold and it wasn’t anything special. Oddly, the entrees were served before the appetizers and the waiter didn’t seem phased at all by this.
I go here about once per month to get a burger and fries. It’s not anything crazy, but a really good burger should be simple and tasty. They don’t over think their food. This place rocks.

BREAD BASKET: a baked joint made with fun butters *loved the butter with Maldon salt and honey butter but was disappointed that the breads weren't warm  NOT YO' MAMA'S CHICKEN SCHNITZEL: topped with arugula salad *chicken is very thin and crispy and the arugula salad was nice and refreshing so this dish had great balance  GLAZED RIBS: smoked rack, with a twice baked potato + cabbage *this portion is definitely large enough to split between 2-4 people depending on how many dishes you order *the meat was extremely dry on one side and tender on the other side so that was a little disappointing *also not a fan of the twice baked potato, ended up only eating a few bites, it was very bland  HANDCUT FRIES: served with betty sauce *Ioved the Betty sauce, really great flavor and the fries were a monster portion  CHEESECAKE: *Rich, creamy and delicious.  WINE & BEER: *selection is pretty small and not great  DRAFT DRINK: *Americano was tasty, dry and bitter.  SERVICE: Consistent.  Our server was nice enough to let us sample some of the wine before committing to a glass.
Great food! Great atmosphere!Great, friendly, & prompt staff! Would definitely visit again & recommend
Staff were super relaxed and friendly , happy hour drinks and snacks were great , recommend the Monte Carlo
Stellar service, beautiful interior design, and the food was really good. Food could have been a bit more seasoned.
Great space. Excellent food.
Overpriced for what it was, food was good though
Food is amazing, staff is amazing, atmosphere is amazing. Love eating here!

Stopped for food & cocktails during happy hour. The food was delicious, cocktails were great, and service was impeccable. I really enjoyed the outdoor seating, too. I highly recommend stopping by if you're in the area.

Yum! What a phenomenal little spot with delicious food all around. I came here with a friend and we were both really excited to try the food since we both love A Baked Joint, La Betty's sister restaurant.  We started with the bread and the corn dogs. Both were excellent but the bread was slightly more appetizing. Bread is something these folks do VERY well. The corn dogs were also a hit and took me back to my childhood when I feel like I had corn dogs at least twice a week. Thanks mom.  I ordered the roast with cabbage for my entree and my friend got the schnitzel. The roast was cooked perfectly! I was actually a little surprised at how good it was. It wasn't dry at all and the cabbage was great alongside it. The schnitzel was also tasty.  We ended the meal with the flourless chocolate cake and that was also divine. Service was friendly and fast. Will be back!

Eating at la Betty is like going to your coolest friends house for dinner and being welcomed like you're family.  The space is comfortable but stylish. You feel at ease as soon as you walked in. I could easily see this as a date night spot, but would also definitely bring my parents here for a fun night when they comes to visit.  You can tell the drink menu is intentionally simple. It's been brought to the essentials, and all of the options are delicious. I had the red wine which was light but full of flavor. I also had a small glass of the darker beer, which was malty and soooo good.  To start we ordered the corn dogs. I love corn dogs in almost every case but these were especially good. For our entrees, we ordered the roast and the schnitzel, and both were truly spectacular. The roast was packed full of flavor - so tender and juicy. You could tell the schnitzel was incredibly fresh - the flavor was really delicate but well balanced.  The service was flawless, and the staff are friendly and attentive without being intrusive.  Overall, I couldn't have hoped for a better experience, and I will definitely be coming back.

Fries with special house sauce are a must. The burger wasn’t amazing, but the chicken schnitzel topped with salad and honey mustard vinaigrette was very good and cooked perfectly.  Blue cheese wedge salad was delicious as well. Didn’t love that the wine was served in cocktail glasses, or that our appetizer came out with the mains, but the very welcoming service staff helped make up for these minor issues.
Everything was excellent.  Will come again.
It was a cool little dim quiet like place. Menu not as abundant but the ribs w twice baked potato was good.
Amazing German food. Classic Kolsch. Fantastic service.

Baked & Wires crew does it again! Beautiful blend of fine dining and family style home cooking. The ribs were amazing and our baby crushed his baked potato.  The service is very attentive without being annoying and they offer up shots to start and end your meal. It’s like having a dinner party and your best friend’s house.  BW team is 3 for 3!
Food like you wish your Mom could make.

We went to La Betty with another couple and everyone was very happy with their food and we loved the decor and great service.  I think the best way to describe this place is unique, simple but hearty.  The menu is small but they have something for everyone from Ribs to vegetarian options.  The ribs and chicken were amazing! But the desert was the best part of the meal.  The owners also own two bakeries so the breads and deserts were top notch.  We will be back, great experience overall.
Incredible
From the rockstars that did Baked Joint and Baked and Wired comes a new awesome space with awesome food, awesome service! We are THRILLED to have this in the neighborhood! Keep in rocking!

Maybe I expected too much from this place? And in fairness I will review again when they've been open longer. The food and the service were great, my main issue was with the drinks. Two beers, neither of them local. One cocktail (on draft) that is about half strength. There are a variety of liquors available as shots(?), but apparently mixing these with anything is not possible.
Homey yet edgy vibe, and the food is among the best of DC. 10/10.
la betty was la best-y
INCREDIBLE place. The space was amazing and the food was even better!!! 5 stars !!!!

A wonderful, unpretentious addition to the DC restaurant community. A simple, paired down menu with high quality, flavorful food you might find at your favorite home cooked meal. It can be hard to find a place to eat in this city that isn't aspiring to be the next Michelin starred spot with a Bon Appetit profile attached to it. The food and drink at La Betty are on par with those places, but the warm unassuming atmosphere makes you feel as comfortable as you are in your own living room.  The staff is incredibly knowledgeable about both the food and drink. The beer service is inspired by the wonderful beer halls of Cologne, Germany, with 8 oz pours that seemingly refill themselves with the amazing table service.  I look forward to coming back many times!

I’ve been waiting for la betty to open for months and it did not disappoint – great ambiance and delicious food!  I love the ambiance here. Soft lighting, wooden table, edgy and fun art… it made me so happy to walk into a place with such welcoming, kind, and helpful service staff, too.  On the fooooood, chicken schnitzel was my favorite! I could honestly have this every day. It's the right amount of crispy without being oily. I also got handcut fries as a side 😉 - it comes with a delicious green sauce which is kinda refreshing and creamy at the same time. One surprise for me was their deviled eggs – I usually don’t even like deviled eggs, but this was really delicious! The right balance of creamy and nice egg white texture.  Oh, and the cheesecake. It's a must. Just do it. (I’ve been craving cheesecake every day since I had it at la betty.)

Unsurprisingly, the team from Baked and Wired & A Baked Joint have done it again! La Betty is such a fresh, hip addition to DC. I've already been twice and will continue to visit frequently. The design of the restaurant is top notch, the food is delicious (of course!) and the staff is awesome. So happy that this great team continues to find success in their new venture :)

Went to their first night soft opening. An amazing success all around. Simple hearty meals done right with the same quality as A Baked Joint and Baked and Wired. Chicken schnitzel holds its own with the best I've had in Europe, and the vegan galette pulls off the magic trick of crispy, flaky pastry with no butter. The French fries are some of the best you will find on the east coast. Great food, top notch service, excellent ambience. Come get several rounds of tiny beers, some candied nuts and have a wonderful evening.

I absolutely LOVE this place! Same family as behind A Baked Joint next door, this new restaurant offers delicious home style cooking and family plates with amazing ambiance and an awesome drinks program of small refreshing beers, draft cocktails and wines. Well done!
Amazing food and great service!!!
